alert.note: Alert for Albemarle; Augusta; Nelson (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 26 at 8:55PM EDT until June 27 at 1:00AM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Sterling Virginia has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southwestern Albemarle County in central Virginia... Nelson County in central Virginia... Southeastern Augusta County in western Virginia... * Until 100 AM EDT. * At 855 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Sherando... Shipman... Schuyler... Wintergreen... Montebello... Nellysford... Arrington... Lovingston... Bryant... Jonesboro... Greenfield... Tyro... Roseland... Massies Mill... Elma... Rockfish... Faber... Piney River... Tye River... Covesville... FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
